channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: a16z partner Kofi Ampadu to leave firm after TxO program pause
item.description: Kofi Ampadu, the partner at a16z who led the firm's Talent x Opportunity (TxO) fund and program, has left the firm.

item.title: I tested the world’s first f/1.4 135mm prime, and it’s a portrait photographer’s dream
item.description: The Sigma 135mm f/1.4 DG | A is the world’s-first 135mm prime with an f/1.4 aperture and replaces its nearly decade old predecessor.

item.title: ‘Fun, flexible and affordable’ – I tested Ikea’s super-cheap Bluetooth speaker and, as long as you’re not expecting Sonos-toppling sound, it’s a blast
item.description: I tested Ikea’s extremely budget Bluetooth banger – and it’s a really fun way to create a mock multi-room system for less moolah.

item.title: ‘One month out and they’re still building Tomorrowland’: unseen footage reveals the incredible story of the making of Disneyland
item.description: TechRadar chatted with Leslie Iwerks, director of Disneyland Handcrafted, on how rare archival footage was pieced together to tell the story of Disneyland’s last-minute construction – and why its original ideas still matter today.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein was permanently banned from Xbox Live
item.description: Would it surprise you to learn Microsoft booted Jeffrey Epstein from its online gaming platform? As spotted by XboxEra, the latest batch of Epstein's emails shows that in December 2013, he was "permanently suspended due to harassment, threats, and/or abuse of other players." But it appears the real reason may be simpler: A second email […]
